did.abstract: Orah Cole Briscoe was an Indiana University alumna and wife of chemistry professor and Dean of Faculties Herman T. Briscoe. Collection consists of correspondence, research and writings, and general files.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Orah Cole Briscoe, born 1907, was an Indiana University alumna, earning her Bachelor of Arts in 1929 and her Master of Arts in English in 1934. As an undergraduate she was a member of the Kappa Delta sorority. In 1928 she married Herman T. Briscoe, a distinguished chemistry educator who joined the Indiana University chemistry faculty in 1924, went on to serve as chairman of the department, and was appointed as the first Dean of Faculties in 1940. Orah was active in university life, and in 1947 she founded the General Association of Teachers, Employees, Wives, Administrators of the Yooniversity (GATEWAY) club to promote sociability among members of the entire University. Orah died in 1972.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into three series: Correspondence, Research and writings, and General files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is organized into three series: Correspondence, Research and writings, and General files. The Correspondence consists largely of letters from Indiana University friends and faculty and also includes letters of sympathy following the death of Herman T. Briscoe in 1960.

The Research and writings series consists primarily of papers relating to her master's thesis on Indiana authors. Included are author correspondence files which hold letters from Indiana authors, authors' family members, public libraries, and publishing companies. The general research correspondence includes a letter from the English Department awarding her MA. Also included is a typed and handwritten draft of her thesis, The Hoosier School of Fiction, pt. 1: Indiana Fiction Before 1870, as well as poetry authored by Briscoe.
General files include clippings, programs for musical performances, and GATEWAY meeting announcements on index cards.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University through a Deed of Gift. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Orah Cole Briscoe papers, Collection C460, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Accession 0458 came to the Archives after 1972; gifted to the Archives by son Robert Briscoe; Accession 2006/020 was found in Chancellor Wells' office after his death.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Dina Kellams and Danielle Emerling.
